data.enText: very excited and pleased
data.chText: 非常兴奋；极为激动

data.enText: He was thrilled at the prospect of seeing them again.
data.chText: 他一想到將要再次见到他们便欣喜若狂。

data.enText: I was thrilled to be invited.
data.chText: 我有幸受到邀请，感到非常兴奋。

data.enText: She was thrilled to bits (= extremely pleased) that he'd been offered the job.
data.chText: 她得知他得到了这份工作简直乐不可支。

data.enText: ‘Are you pleased?’ ‘I'm thrilled.’
data.chText: “你高兴吗？”“我太兴奋了。”

data.text: glad ♦ happy ♦ pleased ♦ delighted ♦ thrilled ♦ overjoyed

data.enText: These words all describe people feeling happy about sth that has happened or is going to happen.
data.chText: 以上各词均形容人对已经发生或将要发生的事感到高兴、愉快。

data.enText: glad
[not usually before noun] happy about sth or grateful for it
data.chText: 指高兴、愉快、感激：

data.enText: He was glad he'd come.
data.chText: 他很高兴他来了。

data.enText: She was glad when the meeting was over.
data.chText: 会议结束时她很高兴。

data.enText: happy
pleased about sth nice that you have to do or sth that has happened to sb
data.chText: 指对必须做的或发生于某人身上的事感到高兴、快乐：

data.enText: We are happy to announce the engagement of our daughter.
data.chText: 我们高兴地宣布，我们的女儿订婚了。

data.enText: pleased
[not before noun] happy about sth that has happened or sth that you have to do
data.chText: 指对已经发生或必须做的事感到高兴、愉快、满意：

data.enText: She was very pleased with her exam results.
data.chText: 她对考试成绩非常满意。

data.enText: You're coming? I'm so pleased.
data.chText: 你要来呀？我太高兴了。

data.enText: glad, happy or pleased?
data.chText: 用glad、happy还是pleased？

data.enText: Feeling pleased can suggest that you have judged sb/sth and approve of them. Feeling glad can be more about feeling grateful for sth. You cannot be ‘glad with sb’.
data.chText: pleased表明对人或事有所评判的赞同，glad多表示为某事的感激，但不说glad with sb：

data.enText: The boss should be glad with you.
Happy can mean glad or pleased or satisfied.
data.chText: happy表示高兴、愉快、满意。

data.enText: delighted
very pleased about sth; very happy to do sth; showing your delight
data.chText: 指高兴的、乐意的、愉快的：

data.enText: I'm delighted at your news.
data.chText: 听到你的消息我非常高兴。

data.enText: Delighted is often used to accept an invitation.
data.chText: delighted常用于接受邀请：

data.enText: ‘Can you stay for dinner?’ ‘I'd be delighted (to).’
data.chText: “请留下来吃晚饭吧！”“我非常乐意。”

data.enText: thrilled
[not before noun] ( rather informal ) extremely pleased and excited about sth
data.chText: 指非常兴奋、极为激动：

data.enText: I was thrilled to be invited.
data.chText: 我获得邀请，感到非常兴奋。

data.enText: overjoyed
[not before noun] extremely happy about sth
data.chText: 指非常高兴、欣喜若狂：

data.enText: She was overjoyed at the birth of her daughter.
data.chText: 女儿的出生使她高兴不已。

data.enText: delighted, thrilled or overjoyed?
data.chText: 用delighted、thrilled还是overjoyed？

data.enText: Overjoyed or thrilled may express a stronger feeling than delighted , but delighted can be made stronger with absolutely , more than or only too . Overjoyed and thrilled can be made negative and ironic with not exactly or less than .
data.chText: overjoyed或thrilled比delighted的语气强烈，但delighted与absolutely、more than或only too连用语气会更强。overjoyed和thrilled与not exactly或less than连用可变为否定或含讽刺意味：

data.enText: She was not exactly overjoyed at the prospect of looking after her niece.
data.chText: 想到要照料她的侄女，她就高兴不起来了。

data.enText: to be/feel glad/happy/pleased/delighted/thrilled/overjoyed
to look/seem/sound glad/happy/pleased/delighted/thrilled/overjoyed
to be glad/happy/pleased/delighted/thrilled/overjoyed that…/to see/hear/find/know…
to be glad/happy/pleased/delighted/thrilled/overjoyed for sb
to be glad/happy/pleased/delighted/thrilled/overjoyed about sth
to be pleased/delighted/thrilled/overjoyed at sth
very glad/happy/pleased
absolutely delighted/thrilled/overjoyed

example.ex: I was so thrilled to get a good report from him...
example.tran: 收到他的好消息让我欣喜若狂。

example.ex: Sue and John were especially thrilled with this award...
example.tran: 休和约翰对于获得这个奖项感到兴奋不已。

example.ex: I'm really thrilled that the public have taken to the song.
example.tran: 看到大家喜欢上了这首歌，我真是太高兴了。

defx.def: If you say that someone is thrilled to bits, you are emphasizing the fact that they are extremely pleased about something. You can also say thrilled to pieces, especially in American English.

example.ex: I'm thrilled to bits to have won the cash...
example.tran: 能赢得这笔钱，我高兴坏了。

example.ex: He's thrilled to bits at the news...
example.tran: 听到那个消息，他激动不已。

example.ex: He just thoroughly enjoyed reading it with me and was thrilled to bits that it was his very own story.
example.tran: 他非常喜欢和我一起读这个故事，而且因为描写的正是他自己而感到兴奋不已。

gramarinfo.label: v-link ADJ, oft ADJ to-inf, ADJ prep, ADJ that
v-link PHR, oft PHR to-inf, PHR <l>at/with</l> n/-ing

value.def: If someone is thrilled, they are extremely pleased about something.
value.tran: 欣喜若狂的;非常开心的
